content.description: Furthest bolted route to the Left on plasma wall. Start up a hollow flake and move R to a tricky move utilising an undercut. Finish more easily on the slab above.

Short, powerful crux climbing through roof low on route. Big dyno move to a good hold above the roof, followed by a couple powerful deadpoints to good holds. Once the big flake is reached the nature of the climbing changes drastically. Delicate face climbing at a low 5.11 level.
content.location: Between Chalkdust Torture and Meant to Be. Climbs through obvious roof.

content.description: Climb easier slab up to second bolt then climbing changes dramatically. Pull up very steep section using a ramp feature and making some heroic movements to a rest then pull a final boulder problem to the top. Short but packs a punch.
content.location: Start as for plasma and end on kinship anchorâ€™s. Climbs up steepest part of the plasma wall.

content.description: Another short steep bouldery route. First half is good, the upper section is somewhat undesirable.
content.location: Climbs the right side of the overhanging roof feature. Starts up a vertical wall, then a short slab, then climbs gorgeous orange and white stone for a short section.

content.description: Just L of the corner, on the far R of plasma wall. Start under a short section of leftward facing overlapping grooves to a steeley crux at the 3rd bolt. This leads to a short slab on chickenheads. Go L into the corner above and another stout section, to reach the chains of "ribbed"
The "warm up" at the Plasma Wall. A short technical face followed by a low angle section, then some funky climbing up a chimney, followed by some slab climbing.
content.location: Starts with a large undercling pocket for the left hand. Look for the chimney like feature which separates the right overhanging wall where Kinship and Plasma are located and the left vertical/ slabby wall where Chalkdust et al are located.

content.description: A super fun, short steep bouldery route. Climbs through some awesome stone on good holds through the steep section. Big pulls on good holds. My pick for the best route on Plasma Wall
content.location: Begins on a vertical face, transitions to a short low angle section, then onto the steep business.

content.description: follows the steepest section of the L side of plasma over bulges on chickenheads. Just R of "thats what"
direct to reach soap at the 5th bolt.
follows the Rightward trending flake line via a series of interesting barndoor moves. Finish more easily up the long discontinuous slab above. ***NEEDS 70m ROPE***
Furthest route R on plasma wall. Takes a flowstone corner to short overhang.

Begins with some energetic pulls through a roof section and turns into sustained steep face climbing. One crux low pulling the roof and another tricky section up high after a good rest in the smooth dihedral.
content.protection: Bolts. They look a little spread out from the ground but when you are on it they feel adequate.
content.location: Begins in a small cave, the trail spits you out right in front of Chalkdust
